alert.note: Alert for Logan; Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 09 at 6:22PM CDT until June 09 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Yell County in central Arkansas... South Central Logan County in western Arkansas... * Until 930 PM CDT. * At 622 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the past hour...from Blue Mountain...to Havana...to Belleville. Additional heavy rainfall is expected as slow moving thunderstorms continue to move over these same areas. As a result...flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Danville, Magazine, Blue Mountain, Stonehouse Recreation Area, Belleville, Havana, Corinth, Waveland, Waltreak, Macedonia in Yell County, Spring Lake Campground and Sugar Grove. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
